ccpn.ui.gui.lib.GuiGenerator module¶

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.GuiGenerator.generateWidget(params, widget, argsDict=None, columns=1)[source]¶
ccpn.ui.gui.lib.GuiGenerator.selectedRadioButton(self, argsDict, param)[source]¶

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.PeakAssignment module¶

Module Documentation here

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.PeakAssignment.filterIntraResidual(nmrAtomsForDimensions: List[ccpn.core.NmrAtom.NmrAtom])[source]¶

Takes a N-list of lists of nmrAtoms, where N is the number of peak dimensions and only returns those which belong to residues that show up in at least to of the dimensions (This is the behaviour in v2, if I am correct).

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.PeakAssignment.getAssignmentToleranceForPeakDimension(peak: ccpn.core.Peak.Peak, dim: int)[source]¶
ccpn.ui.gui.lib.PeakAssignment.intersectionOfAll(sets)[source]¶
ccpn.ui.gui.lib.PeakAssignment.matchingNmrAtomsForDimensionOfPeaks(peaks: List[ccpn.core.Peak.Peak], dim: int, nmrAtoms: List[ccpn.core.NmrAtom.NmrAtom], doubleTolerance: bool = False)[source]¶

Finds out which nmrAtom can be assigned to a specific dimension of all the peaks, the N dimension for instance. Only returns those nmrAtoms that can be assigned to this dimension of all the selected peaks.

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.PeakAssignment.matchingNmrAtomsForPeakDimension(peak: ccpn.core.Peak.Peak, dim: int, nmrAtoms: List[ccpn.core.NmrAtom.NmrAtom], doubleTolerance: bool = False)[source]¶

Just finds the nmrAtoms that fit a dimension of one peak.

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.PeakAssignment.matchingNmrAtomsForPeaks(peaks: List[ccpn.core.Peak.Peak], nmrAtoms: List[ccpn.core.NmrAtom.NmrAtom], doubleTolerance: bool = False)[source]¶

Get a set of nmrAtoms that fit to the dimensions of the peaks. This function does the actual calculation and does not involve filtering like in nmrAtoms_for_peaks, where more filters can be specified in the future.

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.PeakAssignment.nmrAtomsForPeaks(peaks: List[ccpn.core.Peak.Peak], nmrAtoms: List[ccpn.core.NmrAtom.NmrAtom], intraResidual: bool = False, doubleTolerance: bool = False)[source]¶

Get a set of nmrAtoms that fit to the dimensions of the peaks.

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.PeakAssignment.peaksAreOnLine(peaks: List[ccpn.core.Peak.Peak], dim: int)[source]¶

Returns True when multiple peaks are located on a line in the given dimensions.

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.PeakAssignment.sameAxisCodes(peaks: List[ccpn.core.Peak.Peak], dim: int)[source]¶

Checks whether all peaks have the same axisCode for in the given dimension.

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.PeakAssignment.withinTolerance(nmrAtom: ccpn.core.NmrAtom.NmrAtom, position: float, shiftList: ccpn.core.ChemicalShiftList.ChemicalShiftList, tolerance: float)[source]¶

Decides whether the shift of the nmrAtom is within the tolerance to be assigned to the peak dimension.

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.PeakList module¶

Module Documentation here

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.PeakList.restrictedPick(peakListView, axisCodes, peak=None, nmrResidue=None)[source]¶

Takes a Peak or an NmrResidue, not both, a set of axisCodes, and a PeakListView. Derives positions for picking and feeds them into a PeakList wrapper function that performs the picking.

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.Qt module¶

Qt related utility functions

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.Qt.interpretEvent(event)[source]¶

Interpret drop event and return (type, data)

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.SpectrumDisplay module¶

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.SpectrumDisplay.makeStripPlot(spectrumDisplay: ccpn.ui.gui.modules.GuiSpectrumDisplay.GuiSpectrumDisplay, nmrAtomPairs: List[List[ccpn.core.NmrAtom.NmrAtom]], autoWidth=True, widths=None)[source]¶
ccpn.ui.gui.lib.SpectrumDisplay.makeStripPlotFromSingles(spectrumDisplay: ccpn.ui.gui.modules.GuiSpectrumDisplay.GuiSpectrumDisplay, nmrAtoms: List[ccpn.core.NmrAtom.NmrAtom], autoWidth=True)[source]¶
ccpn.ui.gui.lib.SpectrumDisplay.navigateToPeakPosition(project: ccpn.core.Project.Project, peak: ccpn.core.Peak.Peak = None, selectedDisplays: List[ccpn.ui.gui.modules.GuiSpectrumDisplay.GuiSpectrumDisplay] = None, strip: ccpn.ui.gui.modules.GuiStrip.GuiStrip=None = None)[source]¶

Takes a peak and optional spectrum displays and strips and navigates the strips and spectrum displays to the positions specified by the peak.

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.Strip module¶

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.Strip.isPositionWithinfBounds(strip: ccpn.ui.gui.modules.GuiStrip.GuiStrip, shift: ccpn.core.ChemicalShift.ChemicalShift, axis: object)[source]¶

Determines whether a given shift is within the bounds of the specified axis of the specified strip.

NBNB Bug Fixed by Rasmus 13/3/2016. This was not used then. Maybe it should be?

Modified to use aliasingLimits instead of spectrumLimits. Rasmus, 24/7/2016

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.Strip.matchAxesAndNmrAtoms(strip: ccpn.ui.gui.modules.GuiStrip.GuiStrip, nmrAtoms: List[ccpn.core.NmrAtom.NmrAtom])[source]¶
ccpn.ui.gui.lib.Strip.navigateToNmrAtomsInStrip(strip: ccpn.ui.gui.modules.GuiStrip.GuiStrip, nmrAtoms: List[ccpn.core.NmrAtom.NmrAtom], widths=None, markPositions: bool = False)[source]¶

Takes an NmrResidue and optional spectrum displays and strips and navigates the strips and spectrum displays to the positions specified by the peak.

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.Strip.navigateToPositionInStrip(strip, positions: List[float], axisCodes: List[str] = None, widths: List[float] = None)[source]¶

Takes a strip, a list of positions and optionally, a parallel list of axisCodes. Navigates to specified positions in strip using axisCodes, if specified, otherwise it navigates to the positions in the displayed axis order of the strip.

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.Window module¶

ccpn.ui.gui.lib.Window.markPositions(project, axisCodes, atomPositions)[source]¶

Takes a strip and creates marks based on the strip axes and adds annotations where appropriate.
